Parameters: used to communicate with Google Play Services. This should be configured to use @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#Address#API_E@. Must not be null.

used to specify what kind of addresses your app can handle. You must pass in a valid @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#UserAddressRequest_E@ created via @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#UserAddressRequest#Builder#build_E@.
used @B_android#app#Activity#onActivityResult_E@ to identify which request triggered that callback.
requestUserAddress(com.google.android.gm.Description: API to request an address from a user. This will invoke a dialog that allows the user to decide if they want to select a single address to share your app, or alternatively decline to share an address at all. The response to this request is supplied via your Activity's @B_android#app#Activity#onActivityResult_E@ callback method. If the user selects an address to share, a response code of @B_android#app#Activity#RESULT_OK_E@ is returned. You can retrieve the @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#model#UserAddress_E@ from the data Intent sent to @B_android#app#Activity#onActivityResult_E@ using the @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#model#UserAddress#fromIntent_E@ key. If the user declines to share an address, a response code of @B_android#app#Activity#RESULT_CANCELED_E@ is returned. If there is an error retrieving addresses for the user, for example if the user has no applicable addresses, then a response code of @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#AddressConstants#ResultCodes#RESULT_ERROR_E@ is returned. You can retrieve the error code from the data Intent using the @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#AddressConstants#Extras#EXTRA_ERROR_CODE_E@ key.
requestUserAddress(com.google.android.gm.FullName: public static void requestUserAddress (GoogleApiClient googleApiClient, UserAddressRequest request, int requestCode)

ClassDesc: APIs for accessing a user's address. Calling @B_com#google#android#gms#identity#intents#Address#requestUserAddress_E@ will prompt the user to select an address to share with your application.
